( Carnage: I do so apologize, I really did not mean to be late at least two 
weeks. You see, my main mainframe had shut down on me and I had to reformat 
it.
And thank you Fire Fox for being so patent, I shall have to return the favor 
one-day.
Again, my apologies.)


I COMP: Current mech-fluid level at 45% and rising, Neural activity 
currently at 3%, complete systems overhaul in 60.3 cycles.

** That was the status of his condition, and that was all.
His fluid level was indeed rising, reproducing in mass numbers the cells in 
which merged and produced the mech-fluid needed to sustain his large body.
However, his brain had been damaged due to the lack of air for the period of 
time he had not been treated, slightly stunned and taking its time to 
reformat its self and receive the fluid being fed into it slowly.
Every one of his systems had gone offline except for the main hard drive, 
which sustained his spark and kept it functional. However, since his brain 
activity was slowly returning it would send a shock through his systems to 
reactivate them, an overhaul.

But, even with his brain inoperative, his consciousness was still intacked 
and completely functional:

There was nothing but darkness from what he could tell, eventually testing 
the blackness by trying to see if he could see his hand in front of his 
face�he couldn�t.
He looked all about him, but it was all as pitch black as molten tar.
But then, all of a sudden and completely out of nowhere he heard a scream. 
One so loud and bloody piercing that he had to cover his receptacles in 
order to keep them from cracking and deactivating.
As soon as she scream died away he cautiously removed his hands from the 
side of his head and looked around slightly, wondering where that scream had 
come from and who or what had caused it.
But there was still nothing other then the darkness surrounding him, 
suffocating him like a wool blanked covering a new born child�s face.
However, a fear slowly crept into his spark, threatening to cease it�s 
beating pulse. He recognizes the sound of that cream, or what he had been 
able to hear of it. It was Tavatrons.
But where was she�where was HE?
Perhaps if he could somehow figure out where he was, he could find a way to 
get out of there and locate Tavatron? But first he had to find out 
where,�there� was.

Dinobot was just about to begin to wander around when there was a sudden 
flash of light, causing him to stumble and fall onto his back. Instinctively 
covering his optics with a hand and keeping still. A roaring filled his 
sense as he lay there, waiting for everything to stop so he could at least 
see what was doing on�but the light kept his optics closed and protected 
from what was happening around him.
But then, all in one breath�it all stopped. The spinning, the roar, the 
light just�all ceased to be.
Dinobot let out the breath he had been holding in one long sigh, slowly 
removing his hand from his face and opening his optics tentatively�and 
almost gasped at what he saw.
Millions upon millions of stars!
All sparking like a billion diamonds lying on a black velvet cloth, each 
varying from the size of a large diode to that of the smallest dot, barely 
visible.
All there, right infant of him, or�above him.

There was a sudden slight tickling sensation along every side of his body as 
he felt a cool breeze sweep over his exostructure, turning hie head to see 
just what it is�only for his optics to turn and see the long green grass 
the�surrounded him?
Dinobot sat up slowly and surveyed the land around him, surprised to see 
himself sitting in a fast field of waving grass, African trees outlining a 
forest edge in the far distance and a small herd of zebra just before the 
trees.
He felt his stomach clench and growl loudly as he counted the number of 
plain creatures, turning his head to look down as he gave it a small pat to 
keep it quite�but his hand froze before he could do so�his optics widening 
in surprise.
This wasn�t what he was use to seeing�well�not from what he remembered 
before he was damaged and had blacked.
Instead of a silver outline structure and clawed transmetal hands�there he 
saw the three fingered and two thumbed hand of his old organic mode, his 
chest the flattened head of the brown and black velociraptor instead of the 
familiar red and silver.
His optics turned and looked down the remainder of his body, seeing that it 
was the same past mode as he remembered. And as he felt slightly alien in 
the transmetal 2 body�he felt truly at home in this one.
With a relaxing sigh he stretched his arms and felt the organic muscle move 
underneath the synthetic skin, then with a heave he pulled himself to his 
feet and stretched again, enjoying every bit of it.
In all his life, he would have never guessed he would be so glad to be back 
in this rusting, battle scared, war toned body of his again�but he was. And 
it felt great!

His stomach rumbled once again but the craving of water to quench a growing 
thirst stung his throat first, his optics quickly finding a watering hole 
that happened to be rather close to the herd of zebra as well.
With words he knew more well then the wheel of time he transformed into hie 
Beast Mode, feeling even stronger muscles clench at his legs and arms.
Now, this was more then he could have ever asked for.
Starting towards the clear water a mile or two away he thought of just how 
this was so different then that transmetal body, how it felt so much better 
to feel warm and hard muscle work your joints instead of the wires and main 
turbines of the TM2 mode.

However, even as he made his way towards the watering hole he suddenly heard 
the same scream as he had heard before, before all of the commotion had 
occurred and he had ended up here�in this wonderful place. He had almost 
forgotten that he was to seek her out, and that was just what he was going 
to do now�slag the water. He had to find Tavatron!

Dinobot growled deeply in his organic throat as he then switched course and 
soon found himself at a full run towards the direction that the scream had 
come from.
It wasn�t long before he came over a grassy ridge and finally saw her, 
strapped to a long wooden pole , not moving at all.
He quickly transformed into robot mode and got down the small his as fast as 
he could without falling, finally reaching its base and looking around. Now, 
somebot had to have put her up there, and they could be around there still.
But he proceeded, still wondering just who had put her up and tied her upon 
the wooden stake.
Just as he approached the stake the image of Tavatron raised her head 
slightly and looked at him, not a speck of emotion on her face.**

� Who did this?�

** The image looked at him with optics that suddenly looked weak and 
pitiful, and if he had been any less a cold slag he would have hugged her 
and hoped that she would cheer up. However, the words the came from her 
throat chilled him.**

� You did��

** Dinobot looked confused for a moment, wondering if she had just been 
delirious from lack of sleep or something to that effect, knowing that the 
bags under her optics was more then just appearance.
He reached over to try and see if he could rip off one of the ropes which 
held her to the stake when a soft voice spoke up, it seeming to come from 
everywhere at once.**

V: � You hid your feelings for her, you refuse to admit that there is at 
least one bot in the universe that cares for you.�

** Dinobot took his hands away from the ropes as he turned around and looked 
all about him, trying to see if he could somehow locate the source of the 
voice�but he could not. It spoke again.**

V: � Your lack of self freedom binds her to one level of your mind, making 
it almost impossible for you to feel more for her other then simple 
friendship.�

** Then, all of a sudden everything went up in a blaze as bright and fierce 
as any inferno straight out of the pits of hell. Everything disappearing 
instead of the rising flames.
Dinobot shielded his optics from the light a sudden searing pain splitting 
through his entire body, the scene around him wavering for a moment, until 
finally everything went back to the blackness with which he had first 
known�only his own voice ringing back in the darkness.**

� There is no reason�what is blind cannot see��..�

**( Back in the CR room) His body suddenly convulsed quickly, his transmetal 
2 claws digging into the metal surface of the table�and kept digging even 
after the remainder of the body lay still.
A sudden blurt from his internal computer ringing across the room.**

I COMP: Neural activity has increased to precisely 78%. Mech-fluid level now 
at 83%. Repair system activated�

** And with that his spark cavity opened to reveal a rapidly beating spark�a 
green light soon forming within its depths and a few repair coils exiting to 
wrap themselves around Dinobots chest, beginning the slow process of 
repairs.
However, with a muffled groan due to the tubes down his throat, Dinobot 
opened his optics slightly, though still not able to see through them quite 
yet.
But then his stomach heaved a bit, finding himself weakly choking on the 
tubes as he tried to bring in a breath on his own. Still not fully awake.**
